markDown.title: Toggles
markDown.content:
A toggle is a page element used to enable or disable an associated setting or feature. For the most effective toggle usage, consider these toggle best practices: - Toggle settings should take effect immediately without the need for a confirm or save, just as a light switch is immediate. - Subsequent changes to the UI from the change of a toggle setting—such as hiding, showing, enabling, or disabling content-- are not only acceptable, but expected. - Labeling should generally be kept in line and to the left of a toggle, and should imply the on/off or yes/no states. - If necessary, on/off labels should be kept next to a toggle rather than inside the component itself. When used correctly, toggles should follow the best practices listed above. Toggles should be used sparingly—there are few situations in which a toggle is truly the best component choice. If you are questioning whether or not a toggle is the component you need to use, you may want to consider a [checkbox](/components/checkboxes) or [radio button](/components/radio-buttons) instead. --- ## Styling and specs ![toggle types](/images/components/toggles/toggle_Types.svg) We use two different sizes of toggles: Standard and small. **Standard toggles** ![standard toggle specs](/images/components/toggles/standard_Specs.svg) Standard toggles are the same height and use the same padding as buttons. - Width: 80px - Height: 36px - Handle: 36px **Small toggles** ![small toggle specs](/images/components/toggles/small_Specs.svg) Small toggles should be used when space is limited, such as in a table. - Width: 50px - Height: 24px - Handle: 24px **States** Toggles are always in a selected state—on or off—and can be enabled or, less commonly, disabled. A disabled toggle has been locked into it's current state. _Disabled toggles should only be shown if there is a way within the current UI to change it back to enabled._ ![toggle states](/images/components/toggles/toggle_States.svg) **Colors** | State | State image | Handle color | Background color | | ------------ | :----------------------------------------------------------: | :-----------------------------------------------------------------: | ---------------: | | Enabled on | ![enabled on](/images/components/toggles/enabled_On.svg) |
  • White #FFFFFF
  • 1px Stroke - ZUI Gray 100
| ZUI Green 500 | | Enabled off | ![enabled off](/images/components/toggles/enabled_Off.svg) |
  • White #FFFFFF
  • 1px Stroke - ZUI Gray 100
| ZUI Gray 400 | | Disabled on | ![disabled on](/images/components/toggles/disabled_On.svg) |
  • White #FFFFFF
  • 1px Stroke - ZUI Gray 100
| ZUI Green 200 | | Disabled off | ![disabled off](/images/components/toggles/disabled_Off.svg) |
  • White #FFFFFF
  • 1px Stroke - ZUI Gray 100
| ZUI Gray 100 | --- ## Behavior and interaction **Enabled** The handle is flush to one side or the other of the background. When the handle or the background is clicked, the handle slides smoothly, becoming flush with the opposite side of the background. **Disabled** When a toggle is locked, the handle is still flush to one side or the other of the background depending on what state the toggle is locked in. However, when the handle or background is clicked, the handle will wiggle in it's curent position, indicating that the click was recieved, but the toggle state cannot be changed.
